title: Food Rescue with Re-distribution Partners
summary: Evening shifts to collect surplus meals, sort and pack for delivery.
description: Join a small, well-briefed team to pick up surplus food from cafés and restaurants, help with basic sorting, and load boxes for delivery to families. Simple, practical tasks with local coordinators.

title: Community Kitchen Support
summary: Prep, simple cooking, plating, and service with local NGOs/parishes.
description: Help prepare hot meals for people facing food insecurity. Tasks vary by shift (chopping, plating, serving, clean-down). Briefing and hygiene guidance provided.

title: Welcome Kits & Hygiene Packs
summary: Assemble hygiene kits and lightweight care packs for vulnerable families.
description: Quick, family-friendly impact. Help sort donated items and assemble packs (toothbrush, soap, toiletries) for distribution through local partners.

title: Beach Clean-up – Foz do Douro
summary: 2–3h coastal clean with light sorting & micro-audit.
description: Safety briefing, gloves/bags provided, simple categorisation (plastics, glass, mixed). Great for families; contributes to NGO datasets.

title: Riverbank Litter Snapshot
summary: Photo-map hotspots and tally micro-plastics on short sections.
description: Light citizen-science: geotag photos, note litter types/volumes. Results feed local partners to track pollution patterns.

title: Community Gardens Boost
summary: Weeding, mulching, native planting in open garden sessions.
description: Seasonal tasks; tools provided. No experience needed. Helps gardens stay healthy between municipal rounds.

title: Invasive Plants – Serras do Porto
summary: Supervised removal (acacia/mimosa) + planting native saplings.
description: Training and PPE on site. Moderate activity; aim is to restore small patches while documenting impact.

title: Conversation Café for Migrants & Refugees
summary: Friendly PT/EN conversation circles focused on useful themes.
description: Light facilitation; materials provided (topics, cards). Great for visitors who like people-to-people impact.

title: Digital Basics & CV Help Drop-in
summary: Help residents with CV tweaks, email setup, and job portals.
description: Short, practical guidance at a community hub. Simple checklists and templates supplied.

title: Senior Social Hour
summary: 60–90 min of games, music, or story time in small groups.
description: Join existing sessions with a facilitator. Gentle pace; empathy and presence matter most.

title: Tech Buddy for Video Calls
summary: Set up smartphones for calls, photos, and messaging with family.
description: Step-by-step sheets provided. Very rewarding for seniors with family abroad.

title: Shelter Socialization & Walks
summary: Dog walking, cat socialization, light kennel clean-up.
description: On-site briefing and animal handling basics. Wear closed shoes; tasks assigned by staff.

title: Animal adoption
summary: Take simple portraits to improve adoption profiles.
description: We supply a quick shot-list; smartphones are fine. Optional light editing guidance.

title: Supplies Drive & Drop
summary: Buy/bring food or meds; help sort and label donations.
description: We’ll share up-to-date needs per shelter (food, blankets, dewormers). Great if you can’t commit to a shift.

title: Evening Street Rounds
summary: Join an experienced team to distribute meals and essentials.
description: Orientation covers respect, safety, and consent. You’ll help with warm drinks, light dialogue, and referrals.

title: Warm Clothing & Blanket Sort
summary: Sort and prep winter items for targeted distribution.
description: Size-labeling, pairing gloves/socks, quick quality checks. Low-barrier entry, high practical value.

title: Azulejo Photo-Surveys
summary: 1–2h self-guided route to geotag tiles and note condition.
description: Use our map and micro-form. Photos feed an open archive; results shared back with partners.

title: Craft Visibility Sprints
summary: Short photo/video snippets + translations for workshop blurbs.
description: We’ll pair you with an artisan; capture “how-it’s-made” steps and help polish a short description.

title: Oral-History Capture
summary: Record residents’ stories (consent) and digitize old photos.
description: Training on consent and scanning basics. Helps build neighborhood memory maps.

title: Study Buddy (Languages / Basics)
summary: 60-min themed conversation circle or basic homework help.
description: Materials and prompts provided; small-group setting with local facilitator.

title: Library & Archive Digitization
summary: Scan, name, and add metadata to documents/photos.
description: Rain-friendly task; simple workstation workflow and checklist.

title: Festival / Marathon Helper
summary: Water points, wayfinding, or guest information.
description: Event brief on arrival; be ready to stand/move. Schedules vary by event calendar.

title: Zero-Waste Crew
summary: Sorting stations and gentle “bring-your-cup” nudges.
description: Only when event partners provide proper sorting and oversight. Gloves and signage provided.

title: Fundraising Workshops
summary: Creative workshops (cooking, crafts, music) supporting NGOs.
description: Join a hands-on workshop with a local artisan or cook. Your fee is split fairly between the instructor and a partner cause.

title: Bike for a Cause
summary: Half-day cycle tour, guided, with proceeds donated.
description: Explore Porto cycling with a local guide. Margin after costs goes directly to a chosen social or environmental project.

title: Kayak for a Cause
summary: Half-day kayak tour, guided, with proceeds donated.
description: Explore Porto’s river or green belt with a local guide. Margin after costs goes directly to a chosen social or environmental project.

title: Street Fundraising Team
summary: Support local NGOs by joining supervised street fundraising drives.
description: Be part of an official, transparent street fundraising action for causes like food security or animal welfare. Orientation included.
